cli_definition.name: nls
cli_definition.description: List information about the FILEs (the current directory by default). Sort entries alphabetically if none of -cftuvSUX nor --sort is specified.

items.description: Print this help message and exit
Display program version information and exit
use a long listing format
list one file per line
list entries by lines instead of by columns
list entries by columns instead of by lines

arg.name: WORD
arg.notes: across (-x), horizontal (-x), long (-l), single-column (-1), vertical (-C) or comma (-m)

items.description: use format
print directory header and column names in long listing
fill width with a comma separated list of entries
assume tab stops at each COLS instead of 8
set output width to COLS. 0 means no limit
show tree view of directories, optionally limited to DEPTH
show summary report
end each output line with NUL, not newline
do not ignore entries starting with .
do not list . and ..
show only directories
show only files
do not list implied entries ending with ~
do not list implied entries matching shell PATTERN (overridden by -a or -A)
do not list implied entries matching shell PATTERN
sort by modification time, newest first
sort by file size, largest first
sort by file extension
do not sort; list entries in directory order
reverse order while sorting
sort by WORD instead of name

sort dot-files and dot-folders first

enclose entry names in double quotes

append indicator with style STYLE to entry names

arguments.SIZE: Integer with optional unit (e.g., 10K is 10*1024). K,M,G,T,P,E,Z,Y,R,Q (1024^n) or KB,MB,... (1000^n). Binary prefixes: KiB=K, MiB=M, etc.
arguments.TIME_STYLE: full-iso, long-iso, iso, locale, or +FORMAT (like date(1)). If FORMAT is FORMAT1\nFORMAT2, FORMAT1 applies to non-recent and FORMAT2 to recent files.

footnotes.color: With --color=auto, color is used only when stdout is a terminal. LS_COLORS affects settings; see dircolors(1).

environment.name: TIME_STYLE
environment.description: Sets the default time display style if provided

exit_status.meaning: serious trouble (e.g., cannot access command-line argument)
